title: Russia: Citi Becomes Key Partner in St. Petersburg University's Master in Corporate Finance Program
summary: St. Petersburg, Russia - Citi, the world's leading financial corporation, announced partnership with the Graduate School of Management at St. Petersburg University (GSOM SPbU) implementing its Corporate Finance Master's Program.
tag-1: Russia: Citi Becomes Key Partner in St. Petersburg University's Master in Corporate Finance Program
tag-3: St. Petersburg, Russia – Citi, the world's leading financial corporation, announced partnership with the Graduate School of Management at St. Petersburg University (GSOM SPbU) implementing its Corporate Finance Master's Program.
tag-4: The program launched in 2010 and is aimed at preparing highly qualified managers of an international caliber in corporate finance and investment banking. The practical experience of Citi combined with the academic expertise of GSOM SPbU will help this program assume a leading position among graduate programs in corporate finance.
tag-5: Through this agreement with Citi, the Corporate Finance Master's Program will see a number of substantial benefits:
tag-6: "Thirty percent of the program's instructors are invited professors from the leading universities and business schools of Europe. The program will also be enriched with training sessions and lectures based on Citi's methods and case studies," said Alexander Bukhvalov, head of the Masters in Corporate Finance Program.
tag-7: "In 2012 Citi is celebrating 200 years since its inception in 1812. We aspire that Citi's outstanding experience will contribute to this promising project we launch in cooperation with GSOM. From this moment forward Citi will play an active role in all stages of the educational process – from the formation of the curriculum and selection of students to the subsequent employment of graduates," said Ruslan Belyaev, ZAO Citibank's Branch Manager in St. Petersburg.
tag-8: More information about how to apply for Masters in Management programs at GSOM SPbU can be found at http://www.gsom.spbu.ru/en/graduate/candidates/.
tag-9: Citi Citi, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management.
tag-10: Additional information may be found at www.citigroup.com | Twitter: @Citi | YouTube: www.youtube.com/citi | Blog: http://new.citi.com | Facebook: www.facebook.com/citi | LinkedIn: www.linkedin.com/company/citi
tag-11: The Graduate School of Management at SPbU  The Graduate School of Management at SPbU was created within the framework of the priority national project Education based on the Management Department at SPbU (created in alliance with the Haas School of Business, University of California at Berkeley, in 1993). Today it is a leading business school of Russia with a diverse portfolio of business education programs and international acclaim, as seen in its prestigious accreditation by EPAS (Bachelor Program) and AMBA (Executive MBA Program) as well as membership in global alliances of leading business schools (EFMD, AASCB, ???S, PIM and EABIS). GSOM has been ranked the No. 1 Business School in Russia (2008-2011) and No. 2 in Eastern Europe (2010-2011) by EDUNIVERSAL.
tag-12: ZAO Citibank  ZAO Citibank, a full subsidiary of Citi in Russia, has been operating since 1993 when it became one of the first banks with foreign capital to enter the Russian market. Citibank has since grown its business to be among the country's largest banks offering a full range of products and services to corporate and consumer customers. At present, the Bank has over 3,500 employees; its distribution network includes retail branches, 550 ATMs and representative offices in largest cities in Russia, Ukraine and Kazakhstan. Additional information may be found at www.citibank.ru
